eligibility:
10+2 level (Karnataka PUC, ISCE, CBSE, NIOS, other State Boards), and any recognized bodies in India. It is compulsory to have studiedÂ  Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics at the Class 12 th Level.
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Holistic Foundation in Physics Hands-On Laboratory Focus Modern Analytical Techniques Research Opportunities for Undergraduates Comprehensive Chemical Foundation Extracurricular and Professional Growth
what_learn: What you will learn? Computer Skills for Physics: Gain proficiency in using computers for physics-related tasks. Problem Solving: Develop strong problem-solving abilities, a crucial skill in both physics and chemistry. Comprehensive Chemical Foundation: Build a solid understanding of the foundational concepts in chemistry. Computational Physics: Learn to apply computational techniques to solve physics problems. Mathematical Proficiency: Develop strong mathematical skills to tackle complex physics and chemistry challenges. Interdisciplinary Training: Acquire competencies relevant to the evolving physics and allied technology industry, preparing you for a versatile and dynamic career.
modules: Modules Mechanics Year 1 Thermal Physics and Statistical Mechanics Electricity and Magnetism Waves and Optics Year 2 Quantum physics Astrophysics Year 3 Renewable Energy Nuclear and particle physics. Project Classical Mechanics Year 4 Quantum Mechanics
career: Career prospects Scientist: Advance knowledge through research and analysis. Data Analyst: Interpret data across industries. Engineer: Explore diverse engineering roles. Educator: Inspire students in schools and colleges. IT/Software Professional: Solve tech challenges. Financial Analyst: Apply maths and analysis to finance.
